channel.title: Broadway On My Mind – Los Angeles Visionaries Association

item.title: Broadway On My Mind #17: The Jails of Old Los Angeles
item.dc:creator: Richard Schave
item.description: LAVAÂ co-founderÂ Richard SchaveÂ invites you to join him, Nathan Marsak, Gordon Pattison, and other special guests for the latest free walking tourÂ inÂ the series Broadway On My Mind. Join us for a walk around Temple and Broadway to the sites of the historic jails of old Los Angeles. Youâ€™ll learn about the places where criminals were housed, judged […]
item.content:encoded:
LAVAÂ co-founderÂ Richard SchaveÂ invites you to join him, Nathan Marsak, Gordon Pattison, and other special guests for the latest free walking tourÂ inÂ the series Broadway On My Mind.

Join us for a walk around Temple and Broadway to the sites of the historic jails of old Los Angeles. Youâ€ll learn about the places where criminals were housed, judged and sometimes autopsied, from the earliest Yankee-era adobe cells to the grand 1924 Hall of Justice (â€œHOJâ€œ). The tour reveals a giant nexus of law enforcement, encompassing U.S. Attorneys, District Attorneys, the Office of the Sheriff, the countyâ€s central jail, County Supervisors, the Office of Coroner, and more. The history of these lost buildings will be punctuated with historic accounts of mayhem, lynchings, and other sordid tales of woe. Weâ€ll also discuss the 1990s closure of the HOJ and the long process of its restoration. If the criminal and civic history of Old Los Angeles intrigues, donâ€t miss this tour.

The walking tour is free, but reservations are required. If attending both the Sunday Salon and walking tour, please sign up for each event.Â There are no â€œplus ones,â€ so tell your friends to sign up individually. Please donâ€t reserve unless you plan to attend.

You are advised to carryÂ bottled water and to wear good walking shoes and a hat.

 

LAVAÂ co-founderÂ Richard SchaveÂ invites you to join him, Nathan Marsak, Gordon Pattison, and other special guests for the latest free walking tourÂ inÂ the series Broadway On My Mind.

Tour attendees will gatherÂ in the basement of Grand Central Market following the LAVA Sunday Salon,. Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, then set out to explore lost and surviving tunnels along Hill Street & Broadway.

The walking tour is free, but reservations are required. If attending both the Sunday Salon and walking tour, please sign up for each event.Â There are no â€œplus ones,â€ so tell your friends to sign up individually. Please donâ€t reserve unless you plan to attend.

You are advised to carryÂ bottled water and to wear good walking shoes and a hat.

 

Youtube Channel link for Broadway On My Mind Walking Tour #17 September 2016

If you like our work please consider donating!

item.title: Pereira in Peril: LACMA Campus (1965)
item.dc:creator: Richard Schave
item.description: Please join architectural and Southern California historians Alan Hess and Richard Schave for the second in their series of free architectural site visits and talks, â€œPereira in Peril.â€ Come explore the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (William L. Pereira, 1965), and learn about the proposed redevelopment of the campus and the inherent threat this […]
item.content:encoded:
Please join architectural and Southern California historians Alan Hess and Richard Schave for the second in their series of free architectural site visits and talks, â€œPereira in Peril.â€

Come explore the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (William L. Pereira, 1965), and learn about the proposed redevelopment of the campus and the inherent threat this represents to the legacy of mid-century architect Pereira, whose corporate and civic work helped define Los Angeles.

Weâ€ll gather at the Mammoth family sculptures (Howard Ball, 1968) at the eastern edge of the La Brea Tar Pits pool, and then walk over to LACMA to get the lay of the land, verbally peeling back subsequent additions and alterations to present the architectâ€s original vision for the campus.

After touring the campus, you can eat your sack lunch while we wrap up the program with an overview of other Pereira buildings facing imminent threat of demolition and a game plan for the Los Angeles community to advocate for their preservation, and that of other under appreciated architectural landmarks.

Youtube Channel link for Pereira in Peril: LACMA Campus October 2016

If you like our work please consider donating!

Tour attendees will gatherÂ in the basement of Grand Central Market following the LAVA Sunday Salon,. Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, then set out to explore lost and surviving tunnels along Hill Street & Broadway.

You are advised to carryÂ bottled water and to wear good walking shoes and a hat.

item.title: Broadway On My Mind #15: Hill Street
item.dc:creator: Richard Schave
item.description: LAVA co-founder Richard Schave invites you to join him and other special guests for the latest free walking tour in the series Broadway On My Mind. Tour attendees will gather in the basement of Grand Central Market following the LAVA Sunday Salon,. Weâ€™ll begin with a brief slide show, then set out to explore lost […]
item.content:encoded:
LAVA co-founder Richard Schave invites you to join him and other special guests for the latest free walking tour in the series Broadway On My Mind.

Tour attendees will gather in the basement of Grand Central Market following the LAVA Sunday Salon,. Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, then set out to explore lost and surviving structures along Hill Street. Along the way we’ll talk about Clay, the lost street which ran under the Angels Flight’s tracks, the Astor Hotel (still standing) and the Northern (now gone).

The walking tour is free, but reservations are required. If attending both the Sunday Salon and walking tour, please sign up for each event. There are no â€œplus ones,â€ so tell your friends to sign up individually. Please donâ€t reserve unless you plan to attend.

You are advised to carry bottled water and to wear good walking shoes and a hat.

 

Youtube Channel link for Broadway On My Mind Walking Tour #15 July 2016

If you like our work please consider donating!

item.content:encoded:
LAVA co-founder Richard Schave invites you to join Nathan Marsak and other special guests for the latest free walking tour in the series Broadway On My Mind.

Tour attendees will gather in the basement of Grand Central Market following the LAVA Sunday Salon, which features a talk by Nathan Marsak on old Bunker Hill and Angels Flight. Weâ€ll begin with a brief slide show, then set out to explore lost and surviving structures along Hill Street.

You are advised to carry bottled water and to wear good walking shoes and a hat.

 

Youtube Channel link for Broadway On My Mind Walking Tour #13

item.content:encoded:
Join us the latest installment of The Flaneur & The City: Broadway On My Mind walking tour series. (This tour series was originally titledÂ Broadway Streetscape Master Plan Awareness walking tour.) Â 

About This Tour:

This monthâ€s tour will be the fourth of several tours which focus on the architectÂ Robert Brown Young, whose career spans the 19th & 20th centuries, theÂ residential and commercial. His work on Broadway is the perfect introduction to understanding Young and his iconic structures.

item.content:encoded:
Join us the latest installment of The Flaneur & The City: Broadway On My Mind walking tour series. (This tour series was originally titled Broadway Streetscape Master Plan Awareness walking tour.)  

About This Tour:

This monthâ€s tour will be the second of several tours which focus on the architect Robert Brown Young, whose career spans the 19th & 20th centuries, the residential and commercial. His work on Broadway is the perfect introduction to understanding Young and his iconic structures. One of the buildings to be tackled this month is the O.T. Johnson Block.

Youtube Channel link for Broadway On My Mind Walking Tour June 2014

item.title: LAVA Broadway on My Mind walking tour #9 May 2014
item.dc:creator: Richard Schave
item.description: Join us the latest installment of The Flaneur & The City: Broadway On My Mind walking tour series. (This tour series was originally titled Broadway Streetscape Master Plan Awareness walking tour.)   About This Tour: This monthâ€™s tour will be the first of several tours which focus on the architect, Robert Brown Young, whose career spans […]
item.content:encoded:
Join us the latest installment of The Flaneur & The City: Broadway On My Mind walking tour series. (This tour series was originally titled Broadway Streetscape Master Plan Awareness walking tour.)  

About This Tour:

This monthâ€s tour will be the first of several tours which focus on the architect, Robert Brown Young, whose career spans the 19th & 20th century, residential and commercial. His work on Broadway is the perfect setting to begin to understand Young and his iconic structures.

Our goal with these tours is to explore the history of the built environment on Broadway, while seeking to understand the scope of the work of Strategy One, Phase One of the Broadway Streetscape Master Plan and the â€œRoad Diet,â€ which has recently begun.

Press clippings: the walking tour series is featured in Mike Sonksen’s KCET Departures report, “Punk Rock, Poetry, and Public Policy.” 

Video from previous Broadway On My Mind walking tours: tour #1, tour #2, tour #3, tour #4, tour #5.

Youtube Channel link for Broadway On My Mind Walking Tour May 2014
